required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cell-free Tumor DNA in Head and Neck Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Cell-free Tumor DNAand HPV-DNA in Blood Samples From Newly Diagnosed Patients With Head and Neck Cancer

collaborator.agency: Department of Otorhinolaryngology, Head and Neck Surgery and Audiology

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates if head and neck squamous cell carcinoma can be tracked with cell-free tumor DNA, RNA or HPV-DNA, in blood samples from patients referred with suspicion of cancer, and if it can be used in detecting recurrence in patients already diagnosed and treated for head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of head and neck cancer detected with a blood sample
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is to measure the percentage of head and neck squamous cell carcinomas that can be detected using a liquid biopsy (blood sample)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of head and neck cancer recurrence detected with a blood sample
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is to measure the percentage of recurrence in head and neck cancer patients through serial monitoring with liquid biopsies (blood sample)

clinical_study.condition: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

arm_group.description: The aim is to differentiate between patients with head and neck cancer from those without based on a blood sample.
The aim is to identify recurrence through serial monitoring patients with blood samples.

intervention.description: The intervention is a liquid biopsy as a blood sample taken in a peripheral vein. The blood samples are analyzed for cell free DNA, RNA and HPV-DNA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients 18 years old or older
- Suspicion of head and neck cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with cancer within the last 3 years ( apart from basal cell carcinoma)
- Diagnosed with an inflammatory or haematological disease after the age of 18
- Received chemotherapy or immunosuppressive treatment within the last 3 years
- Underwent a FNA ( fine-needle aspiration biopsy) or a biopsy from the head and neck region within 1 week.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Otorhinolaryngology, Head and Neck Surgery and Audiology

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
